actor_awards.notes: Best known for his chilling, stoic performance in the title role of 'The Picture of Dorian Gray' (1945). Unlike many contemporaries, he did not pursue a typical Hollywood leading man career, often choosing character roles in films and television that suited his distinct, patrician style.

filmography.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
filmography.role_description: A corrupt young man somehow keeps his youthful beauty eternally, but a special painting gradually reveals his inner ugliness to all.
filmography.plot: A corrupt young man somehow keeps his youthful beauty eternally, but a special painting gradually reveals his inner ugliness to all.

filmography.title: El Cid
filmography.role_description: A Spanish nobleman and adversary to El Cid during the attempt to unite Spain.
filmography.plot: The fabled Spanish hero Rodrigo Diaz (a.k.a. El Cid) overcomes a family vendetta and court intrigue to defend Christian Spain against the Moors.

filmography.title: King of Kings
filmography.role_description: The Roman governor of Judaea who presides over the trial of Jesus.
filmography.plot: The temporary physical life of the Biblical Savior, Jesus Christ.

filmography.title: The Left Handed Gun
filmography.role_description: A man obsessed with the legend of Billy the Kid, chronicling his life.
filmography.plot: A psychological western based on the life of Billy the Kid, focusing on his friendship with Pat Garrett.

filmography.title: Dragon Seed
filmography.role_description: The youngest son of a Chinese farming family who becomes a guerrilla fighter against Japanese invaders.
filmography.plot: Chinese peasants fight to survive the Japanese invasion of their village during World War II.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Aline MacMahon)

filmography.title: The Diary of a Chambermaid
filmography.role_description: The consumptive, invalid son of a wealthy family who becomes infatuated with the new chambermaid.
filmography.plot: A chambermaid uses her beauty and wit to advance her station in 19th-century France.

filmography.title: The Boston Strangler
filmography.role_description: A refined, closeted gay man who becomes a suspect in the strangler investigation.
filmography.plot: Investigators search for the strangler terrorizing Boston, leading to the arrest of Albert DeSalvo.

filmography.title: Mickey One
filmography.role_description: An artist and sculptor who creates a massive kinetic sculpture and befriends the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A comedian flees the mob and tries to restart his life in Chicago, but is haunted by paranoia.

filmography.title: Joan of Arc
filmography.role_description: Joan's chaplain and confessor who stays by her side.
filmography.plot: The 15th-century French peasant girl Joan of Arc leads the French army against the English.

filmography.title: Rolling Thunder
filmography.role_description: A Mexican official who assists the protagonist in tracking down the gang that killed his family.
filmography.plot: A Vietnam veteran seeks revenge on a gang of thugs who murdered his wife and son during a home invasion.

filmography.title: The Unsuspected
filmography.role_description: The dismissed fiancé of a wealthy heiress, who becomes entangled in a radio host's murder plot.
filmography.plot: A radio mystery host commits a perfect murder, but his niece's return and a mysterious stranger complicate his plans.

filmography.title: Crimes of the Heart
filmography.role_description: The patriarch of the Magrath family whose illness brings the sisters back together.
filmography.plot: Three sisters with very different personalities reunite at the family home in Mississippi after one of them shoots her husband.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress, Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: King David
filmography.role_description: The High Priest of Nob who aids David, incurring the wrath of King Saul.
filmography.plot: An epic film portraying the life of King David, from his battle with Goliath to his reign over Israel.

filmography.title: The Beginning or the End
filmography.role_description: A scientist involved in the development of the atomic bomb.
filmography.plot: A docudrama recounting the development of the atomic bomb during World War II.

filmography.title: Tarzan and the Slave Girl
filmography.role_description: The leader of a lost civilization who captures Jane.
filmography.plot: Tarzan fights to rescue Jane and a group of women who have been kidnapped by a tribe of lion-worshippers.

filmography.title: Destination Murder
filmography.role_description: A nightclub manager who is actually a cold-blooded hitman.
filmography.plot: A woman goes undercover as a nightclub cigarette girl to find the man who killed her father.

filmography.title: The Checkered Coat
filmography.role_description: A psychotic killer who suffers from catalepsy.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist tries to help a cataleptic man who is prone to murderous rages.

filmography.title: Chinatown at Midnight
filmography.role_description: An adventurer who helps the police hunt for a killer in San Francisco's Chinatown.
filmography.plot: Police hunt for a sophisticated killer in San Francisco's Chinatown who is stealing valuable art.

filmography.title: Von Richthofen and Brown
filmography.role_description: The famous Dutch aircraft designer who builds planes for the Germans.
filmography.plot: The story of the rivalry between the Red Baron and the Allied pilot credited with shooting him down.

filmography.title: Her Alibi
filmography.role_description: A mysterious Romanian thug pursuing the main characters.
filmography.plot: A mystery novelist provides an alibi for a beautiful woman accused of murder, hoping she will be the inspiration for his next book.

filmography.title: Harlow
filmography.role_description: The MGM executive who marries Jean Harlow in this biopic (Magna Pictures version).
filmography.plot: A biographical drama about the life and tragic death of 1930s screen siren Jean Harlow.

filmography.title: The Norliss Tapes
filmography.role_description: An art gallery owner involved in a supernatural mystery in this cult TV movie.
filmography.plot: A publisher investigates the disappearance of a writer who was working on a book about the supernatural.

filmography.title: Between Time and Timbuktu
filmography.role_description: A character based on Felix Hoenikker from 'Cat's Cradle' in this Kurt Vonnegut adaptation.
filmography.plot: A young poet wins a contest to be sent into space and experiences a series of surreal adventures based on the works of Kurt Vonnegut.

filmography.title: Thief
filmography.role_description: A professional thief who mentors a younger crook in this TV movie.
filmography.plot: A professional burglar wants to retire, but his debts force him to take on one last job.

filmography.title: Lies of the Twins
filmography.role_description: Hatfield's final screen role, playing a doctor in this psychological thriller.
filmography.plot: A model begins an affair with her therapist's twin brother, leading to a dangerous psychological game.
